text: Is This the End of The World? A Writer's Workshope by Sam Heaps 2/12 - 3/12 More Info here Lot of the Month Join our monthly book subscription service. Choose between small press, fiction, or nonfiction memberships to receive a new book each month, 5% off in-store purchases, and more! Join Now New, Used, and Rare Books We specialize in new and used literary fiction with a healthy stock of nonfiction, zines, art, and children's books. In keeping with a high-brow, low-brow bookstore, we offer some very affordable books along with what goes as rare and interesting in the book world. title: About | Lot 49 Books
text: About Lot 49 Books Fishtown, Philadelphia's Literary Destination Since 2023 Contact Us Talk about your brand Lot 49 Books was founded in 2021 out of the first floor of a house in South Philadelphia. An avid reader and lifelong haunt of brick-and-mortar bookstores, owner Drew Waldo was inspired after reading a Lawrence Ferlinghetti biography describing improvised bookstores in post-war Europe. The store moved to Fishtown in 2023.Named after Thomas Pynchon's novel, "The Crying of Lot 49," the store offers new and used books, focusing on literary fiction, poetry, art books, political histories, and zines. There are no other "Pynchonian" themes to the store, though as a small store with a goal towards good curation the book selection has its niches.In addition to bookselling, Lot 49 hosts events ranging from poetry workshops and readings to art and music shows. It is a true privilege to take part in the vibrant writing and music scenes in Philadelphia as a host. Check the events page on the website for our next event.We encourage customers to sell books to Lot 49 for cash or store credit.

title: Events | Lot 49 Books
text: Upcoming Events Ben Morea In Discussion with Sabu Koshu in conversation for his new memoir Full Circle: A Life in Rebellion. Morea is an artist and activist particularly known for his work in the 1960s based in New York City with Black Mask and Up Against the Wall, Motherfucker! RSVP here for updatesThe event will be seated with opportunity for the audience to join in discussion. Event will be held at:Da Vinci Art Alliance704 Cathraine StPhiladelphia, PA Books available for purchase on the website and at the event. Buy the book here Past Events April 26th, 2025 Rose Books Reader Vol. 1 Launch Rose Book Reader Vol. 1 Launch in Philadelphia Hosted by Lot 49 BooksKatie ColemanNikki Volpicelliat Neon Clown Dream Lounge1248 N Front, upstairs, Philadelphia, PA 191256:30 PMwith readings from:Eric Boyd Cody RoggioBlake Butler Gina TomaineAmy Lyons Ray Wise RSVP on Handstamp here Stay tuned for upcoming events to be listed.

title: Contact | Lot 49 Books
text: Contact Us Any questions, comments, introductions, etc. are welcome and go here.Lot 49 is currently buying new and used books as well as accepting donations. Please reach out with what you have. We will travel for good and interesting collections. Visit Us 408 E. Girard Ave,Philadelphia, PA 19125HoursMonday: 11-5 PM Tuesday - Sunday: 11-6 PM*Hours subject to change, check Instagram for updates Contact form Name Email * Phone number Comment Send
